channel.title: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
channel.description: I bought a Compaq SR2020Nx (it's a few years old) decked it up with 4gb of ram (came with 512mb LMAO) it's worked for years, but now it's not booting, I've re installed windows and used rescue discs and tryed installing Linux, EVERYTHING. Turns out the hard drive died. I found a cheap 300GB internal SATA, at best buy. Should I replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?

item.title: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

well HDDs will run 60-120 for standard sized SATA… and a new decent computer will run 300-400. your computer has pretty crap hardware and one component has already failed in the OEM build. for a long-term investment, i’d consider shelling out 180 more for a new computer that has everything you need. you can also get some money back by selling components from your old pc such as memory and cpu on ebay.

Read full topic
item.source: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?

item.title: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Buy a hard drive for now and then save up your money to buy a newer computer.

Read full topic
item.source: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?

item.title: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I had a situation like this, only it was just dying in general, not any specific part, but almost every part was just running down, so I got the one I have now. I’d recommend buying a new computer from my own experience. Then again, you only need a hard drive, I would have pretty much needed everything but the computer ‘case’.

Read full topic
item.source: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?

item.title: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

If the computer meets your needs and you’re satisfied with it, keep it. You can always make part upgrades to it as time goes on.

Read full topic
item.source: Replace the hard drive, or buy a new computer?
